intro: Folis, commonly known as the leaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers. The leaves of Folis are typically alternate, lanceolate, and often covered in fine hairs. The plant is native to various regions in Europe and Asia, where it thrives in temperate climates. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along roadsides, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
